greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest m such that m > A037153(n) and n!+ m is prime.
comment: a(n) is the second m (first m is A037153(n)) such that m > 1 and n!+ m is prime.
Conjecture: For n > 1, a(n) is prime (compare the conjecture about A037153).
link: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1200
mathematica: A037153[n_] := (For[m=Prime[PrimePi[n]+1], !PrimeQ[n!+m], m++ ]; m); a[n_] := (For[m=A037153[n]+1, !PrimeQ[n!+m], m++ ]; m); Table[a[n], {n, 60}]
results.author: _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Sep 01 2003
